This strategic repositioning allows for rapid deployment in response to potential attacks, alongside observed increases in aircraft and military equipment across the region.

Bank strike on Feb 12: Will banks remain open or closed tomorrow?
description: Bank unions across India have announced a nationwide strike on February 12, protesting the government's new Labour Codes.  Customers face uncertainty as major banks warn of potential operational disruptions, though they are making arrangements for smooth functioning. Unions also advocate for improved work-life balance and a five-day work week.

Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn and others show support for Rajpal Yadav after he surrenders to Tihar jail
description: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case. Following his emotional plea about financial struggles, several Bollywood personalities, including Salman Khan, Ajay Devgn, and Varun Dhawan, have stepped forward to help clear his debt. His manager expressed optimism for his release soon, with a bail hearing scheduled for tomorrow.

title: Trump’s zero tariff on B'desh textiles: Should India worry?
description: Since the European Union accounts for nearly two-thirds of Bangladesh’s garment exports and already provides unconditional duty-free access, the incentive to reorganise supply chains mainly to serve the US market remains limited.

description: Google is offering voluntary exit packages to its global business organization staff. This move signals a strong push for employees to fully embrace the company's AI-driven future. The offer targets those who may not be aligned with the rapid transformation. This is Google's third such plan in a year, aiming to streamline its workforce.

description: Salesforce employees are demanding CEO Marc Benioff publicly condemn ICE following his controversial jokes about the agency at a company event. An internal open letter urges Benioff to denounce ICE's "unconstitutional conduct" and prevent Salesforce's technology from being used for immigration enforcement. Employees are furious, citing past instances where Benioff's influence impacted policy.

title: ‘Why only bowlers?’ Ashwin defends Pakistan spinner as action debate explodes
description: Pakistan spinner Usman Tariq's unique bowling action has reignited debate after a match-winning performance on Tuesday. While critics question his technique, veteran Indian spinner Ravichandran Ashwin defended bowlers, highlighting perceived double standards in cricket's rules compared to batting. Tariq maintains his action is natural, having been cleared by the ICC previously.

description: The Court observed that nothing was recorded to indicate force, coercion or inducement and medical evidence did not substantiate charges of sexual assault.

description: In a significant political shift, Mumbai has appointed Ritu Tawde from the BJP as its new Mayor, with Sanjay Ghadi from the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena stepping in as Deputy Mayor. This pivotal moment ends a near four-year period of administration rule after the BMC elections on January 15, 2026.

description: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha expressed confidence after their T20 World Cup win, stating the team's unique identity is their strength. He highlighted the improved middle-order batting and faith in their bowling attack to defend targets, even modest ones. Agha also noted the batting order's flexibility and the need for improvement in powerplay bowling.

'May not look like it but...': Ben Stokes undergoes surgery, shares pic
description: England Test captain Ben Stokes has successfully undergone surgery for a facial injury sustained during a nets session. The all-rounder shared images of his swollen face, humorously remarking on the cricket ball's condition. This procedure follows a challenging Ashes tour and comes as his captaincy is under review.

'Used Pakistan & threw us like toilet paper': Khawaja Asif's big remark on US
description: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif lambasted past alliances with Washington, stating Islamabad was "used like toilet paper" after serving US interests in Afghanistan. He described terrorism as "blowback" from dictators' past mistakes, lamenting Pakistan's failure to learn from history and its shifting allegiances for short-term gains. The remarks followed a deadly mosque bombing.

General Naravane book row: Delhi Police issues notice to publisher
description: Delhi Police's Special Cell has issued a notice to Penguin Random House India regarding former Army chief General M M Naravane's memoir, 'Four Stars of Destiny'. The publisher clarified the book is not yet published, a stance endorsed by Naravane, amidst a political row over its citation by Rahul Gandhi.

Daily Quiz: On international tournaments and competitions hosted by India
description: Test your knowledge with our daily quiz on international tournaments and competitions hosted by India!

title: T20 World Cup: ICC got tangled in a controversy that wasn’t
description: The BCCI and BCB both erred in the Mustafizur Rahman IPL release dispute. BCB's "safety concern" pretext for avoiding India, fueled by social media, allowed PCB to create unnecessary drama. ICC chairman Jay Shah prioritised cricket, ensuring the tournament proceeded despite Bangladesh's absence, highlighting the distinct economic value of India-Pakistan matches.

title: All 6 stanzas of Vande Mataram must for all govt events, schools: What Centre’s new guidelines say
T20 World Cup: India’s strategic shift ahead of Pakistan clash
description: India's bowlers are intensifying their training to adapt to sluggish tournament pitches, particularly in Colombo. The team is also adjusting batting strategies, moving away from an all-out aggressive approach to incorporate more technique. This shift comes as they prepare for challenging conditions and a crucial match against Pakistan at the T20 World Cup.

title: Cabin crew supervisor accuses friend of sexual assault at Gurgaon hotel room
description: A cabin crew supervisor alleged her friend attempted to disrobe and outrage her modesty in a Gurgaon hotel. The woman had allowed him to share her room due to his financial constraints. A case has been registered under relevant sections of the BNS, and the accused is yet to be apprehended.

title: Mumbai shooting: Teen shot dead over 'love triangle', boyfriend, woman held
description: A 19-year-old woman, Shifa Sheikh, was tragically shot and killed in broad daylight in Govandi's Shivaji Nagar. Her boyfriend and another woman, reportedly infatuated with him, have been arrested. Police are investigating the motive and searching for the shooter, with no witnesses coming forward. The victim was found with critical bullet wounds to her head and neck.

title: Sam Altman, Bill gates and others in Delhi for AI Summit - price of hotel suites at Rs 30L a night
‘SC’s gender handbook too Harvard-oriented’: CJI says Chandrachud-era primer 'very technical'
description: Chief Justice Surya Kant criticized the Supreme Court's gender stereotype handbook as overly technical and inaccessible to common people and rape survivors. He emphasized the need for practical training for High Court judges on handling sexual assault cases. The bench set aside an insensitive Allahabad High Court ruling on an attempted rape case.

title: Donald Trump may make Google, Amazon and other sign new data centre pact
description: The US government is proposing a voluntary pact for tech giants like Google and Meta to cover the full cost of electricity and infrastructure for their AI data centers. This aims to prevent rising household energy prices and strain on water supplies. Companies would also commit to grid reliability and community impact mitigation.
